intro: Homalospermum, commonly known as the desert star or desert broom, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plants are characterized by their shrub-like growth form, with small, compound leaves and yellow or white flowers. Homalospermum species are adapted to drought conditions, featuring deep root systems and reduced leaf surfaces to minimize water loss. They play an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
